title: Women of the silent era : Virgins, vamps and heroines
creator_contributor_role: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Australia - History
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Women in the motion picture industry
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Women
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Women - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Women - Australia
description: This delightful selection of moving images from the past shows on screen roles and highlights the off camera activities of women, in the pioneering days of Australias silent cinema. The featured scenes are from the following films: A Maidens distress (1911) ; The Joan of Arc of Loos (1916) ; The Woman suffers (1918) ; The Breaking of the Drought (1920) ; Sunshine Sally (1922) ; Jewelled nights (1925) ; Painted daughters (1925) ; Those who love (1926) ; The Far Paradise (1928) ; The Cheaters (1929).
